TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IconCriterion

Docs.summary: Represents the criterion for an individual icon in an icon set. The criterion specifies the range of values and the threshold type associated with the icon in an icon set conditional formatting rule.

remarks.para: All of the criteria for an icon set conditional format are contained in an collection. You can access each IconCriterion object in the collection by passing an index into the collection. See the example for details.

example.para: The following code example creates a range of numbers representing test scores and then applies an icon set conditional formatting rule to that range. The type of icon set is then changed from the default icons to a five-arrow icon set. Finally, the threshold type is modified from percentile to a hard-coded number.
example.code: Sub CreateIconSetCF() Dim cfIconSet As IconSetCondition 'Fill cells with sample data With ActiveSheet .Range("C1") = 55 .Range("C2") = 92 .Range("C3") = 88 .Range("C4") = 77 .Range("C5") = 66 .Range("C6") = 93 .Range("C7") = 76 .Range("C8") = 80 .Range("C9") = 79 .Range("C10") = 83 .Range("C11") = 66 .Range("C12") = 74 End With Range("C1:C12").Select 'Create an icon set conditional format for the created sample data range Set cfIconSet = Selection.FormatConditions.AddIconSetCondition 'Change the icon set to a five-arrow icon set cfIconSet.IconSet = ActiveWorkbook.IconSets(xl5Arrows) 'The IconCriterion collection contains all IconCriteria 'By indexing into the collection you can modify each criterion With cfIconSet.IconCriteria(1) .Type = xlConditionValueNumber .Value = 0 .Operator = 7 End With With cfIconSet.IconCriteria(2) .Type = xlConditionValueNumber .Value = 60 .Operator = 7 End With With cfIconSet.IconCriteria(3) .Type = xlConditionValueNumber .Value = 70 .Operator = 7 End With With cfIconSet.IconCriteria(4) .Type = xlConditionValueNumber .Value = 80 .Operator = 7 End With With cfIconSet.IconCriteria(5) .Type = xlConditionValueNumber .Value = 90 .Operator = 7 End With End Sub

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlIcon Icon { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlIcon get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlIcon value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the icon for a criterion in an icon set conditional formatting rule.

remarks.para: After you set the Icon property for the icon criterion in an icon set conditional formatting rule, the property is changed to xlCustomSet.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Index As Integer
public: property int Index { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating which threshold the criteria represents.

remarks.para: For an icon set, this property will return a value of "1" for the minimum threshold, "2" for the next threshold, and so on.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Operator { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets one of the constants of the enumeration, which specifes if the threshold is "greater than" or "greater than or equal to" the threshold value.

remarks.para: For an icon set conditional formatting rule, this property can be set to only one of the following two constants: xlGreater or xlGreaterEqual.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlConditionValueTypes Type { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlConditionValueTypes get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlConditionValueTypes value); };

Docs.summary: Returns one of the constants of the enumeration, which specifies how the threshold value for an icon set is determined. Read-only.

remarks.para: The type of threshold value for an icon set can be a number, percent, formula, or percentile. Setting the type to percentile will use the Percentile function in Excel to determine the threshold value.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ Value { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the threshold value for an icon in a conditional format. Read/write Variant.

remarks.para: You can set the value only if the property for the conditional format is set to one of the following constants: xlConditionValueNumber, xlConditionValuePercent, xlConditionValuePercentile, or xlConditionValueFormula.
If the type of threshold is a formula, you can set the formula as a String. The formula must return a single number.
